Below is an auto-generated list of publications from `references.bib`.

```{=html}
<meta id="pub-years" data-years="2021,2022,2023,2024,2025">

# references
::: (#refs)
:::

{=html}
<script>
(function () {
  const meta = document.getElementById('pub-years');
  if (!meta) return;
  const years = (meta.dataset.years || "")
    .split(",").map(s => s.trim()).filter(Boolean);
  if (years.length === 0) return;
  document.querySelectorAll('#refs .csl-entry').forEach(entry => {
    const txt = entry.textContent || "";
    const keep = years.some(y => txt.includes(y));
    if (!keep) entry.remove();
  });
})();
</script>


**Bottom line:**  
- Want a **curated** list (choose specific papers)? → `bibentry` is perfect. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}  
- Want an **auto list filtered by year**? → use the **Pandoc+JS** snippet above (no extension required).  
(Quarto’s extension catalog confirms `bibentry` is for inline entries, not filtering/listing.) :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
